Detailed Description

A DelegationProvider is the abstract base class of providers that uses a child-provider, i.e. AbstractDelegationProvider or SortProvider. For this reason, it reflects the columns of the underlaying child-provider.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef Provider AbstractDelegationProvider::Base
 

Reimplemented in BubbleSortProvider, CachingSortProvider, ChineseQuickSortProvider, DistinctProvider, FilterProvider, Find2Provider, FindProvider, QuickSortProvider, SortProvider, PbNameFilterProvider, PbNameNumberProvider, PbSimProvider, and PbSortedProvider.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AbstractDelegationProvider::AbstractDelegationProvider (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

AbstractDelegationProvider::AbstractDelegationProvider (  Provider *  child_provider  ) 
 

On construction the following parameters have to be specified: child_provider: The provider which should be manipulated.

AbstractDelegationProvider::~AbstractDelegationProvider (   )  [virtual]

BOOLEAN AbstractDelegationProvider::AppendRow (   )  [virtual]
 

AppendRow reflects AppendRow of the child-provider. or FALSE if no child-provider was set.

CommitRow reflects CommitRow of the child-provider. according to GetMappedRow. Returns FALSE if no child-provider was set.

BOOLEAN AbstractDelegationProvider::GetMappedRow (  INT &  mappedrow,
INT  row
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Reflects by default GetChildRow. If a derived provider class implements a multistage manipulation on the child-provider, the child row of the very first stage must be returned.

Reimplemented in AppendProvider, and DistinctProvider.

void AbstractDelegationProvider::OnExecutingListener (  Provider *  provider = 0  )  [virtual]
 

Called by DelegationProviderListener to modify the progress value. The current version reflects the progress value of the specified provider, or if it is 0, the progress value of the child-provider.

Reimplemented in AppendProvider, MergeProvider, FilterProvider, FindProvider, and SortProvider.

void AbstractDelegationProvider::OnUpdate (  ObservableObject *  obs_obj  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked when the state of the Observable-Object obs_obj has been changed. To get invoked by the Observable-Object the Observer must attach itself by ObservableObject::Attach(this).

Reimplemented from Observer.

Reimplemented in UibInboxProvider.
